title: (From NA) People telling people to kill themselves
body:
> [{quoted}](name=Warpather,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=sz7shtdB,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-01-04T01:11:57.218+0000)
>
> The league of legends community seems to have developed a very bad habit of telling allies and enemies to kill themselves in real life if they do poorly. This is EXTREMELY dangerous to do. Personally i've been through a bit of depression and I believe someone would actually do this if depressed enough. It actually happened to me recently which caused me to post this. I ask that we do something to let Riot know that this is not ok. It poses a real threat to peoples lives. If anyone has any ideas on how to get the word out to riot, i'd like to stop this behaviour as I believe it is exceptionally dangerous.
> TL;DR Summoners telling their allies to kill themselves has got to stop. It's dangerous and unacceptable under any circumstance. Help me tell Rito it has to stop!
> 
> 
> 
> EDIT: Thank you all who have shown your support. If you are just reading this for the first time please post and tell me your examples of how something similar has happened to you! I want RITO to see this. It is important.

From Warpather

Wanted OCE (A.K.A most toxic server >.>) to see how it effects others.

replies.body:
Now I know majority of you won't believe this because you're innocent angels that don't do anything wrong but players are toxic towards others for a  reason. You know that guy that called you a piece of sh#t for taking his main role even though you're a higher pick, well sorry to say this but you both had a part in it.

You know that guy that flamed you for no reason? Well sorry but there was a reason and it's usually because you went 0/12 in 7 minutes to a champ that snowballs hard enough to end games solo before your team even gets the chance to surrender.

Toxicity is a reaction not something that randomly occurs with no reason at all like all the kids who post on the boards begging for a Tribunal might want you to think. I think some easy ways to deal with the "most toxic server" would be to: 
1. Make good use of muting, blocking and reporting.
2. Learn to simply ignore everything that isn't constructive in some way. (Next time someone flames you just ask what you done wrong and you'll notice that people like that are willing to help you but their first reaction is to flame because of the amount of times they've been muted for even hinting at a little bit of constructive criticism.)
3. Don't play Ranked.

lel.

*"Expect toxicity if you play poorly. You deserve it."* - Ezreal God 2015

So someone who goes first time tf in ranked and says "tf is OP, I saw xpeke use him" then feeds 5 kills by the 8 minute mark doesn't deserve to receive toxicity? 

wtf is wrong with this community
No one deserves to receive toxicity, toxic behaviour is always worse than playing badly. Nobody deserves to be verbally abused for how they play in a video game.
i don't get many toxic players tbh i have had no one in the last 200 games tell someone else to kill themselves. It must be a bronze thing not a server related thing.

why has there been such an influx of bronze ezreals/lee sins? 80% of ezreals, lee sins, and twisted fates do really poorly and I wish they would stop picking these champions because they are god awful with them, I ask you because u are an Ezreal main and high elo.

Universal language fillter "yourself" and "urself" in-game. It's never been used beyond telling people to kill themselves anyway.

Problem solved.
i once saw someone say "if your this bad at this game you will never be good at anything at life just kill yourself now to save yourself some pain"

And this is why something needs to be done. That's not something that should be acceptable behaviour at all. Since when did it become okay to be an absolutely horrible excuse fo a human being and make people feel like they should end their own lives? Its disgraceful, I thought we all learnt that if we had nothing nice to say to say nothing at all. It still applies, have some heart.
You need to come to the realisation that it's acceptable to behave in such a manner, I will expect remarks such as this from anyone who can demonstrate a high degree of intelligence.

Here's how we can end it!
All players from bronze to gold 3 are not allowed to use swear words in chat, once you get to gold 2 you stop playing like a baddiey and feeding 8 kills by 20 minutes. 

If someone says that you should commit suicide just think and realise "Hey, I actually did terrible this game, I can see why he is mad at me" and by gold 2 you should know what people say if you do really poorly (in some cases, not all)
*"I actually played terribly this game, I can see why I should kill myself"*
Also to troll hard just run under enemy tower etc if someone says it to you.

Even if you're depressed enough to be contemplating suicide I don't think anyone playing this game would be tipped over the edge by some random on their team telling them to "kill themselves", if your playing this game then you should have thick enough skin to handle insults from randoms. If you don't have thick enough skin chances are you don't play LoL to begin with. When some random tells me to kill myself on this game it doesn't change anything about how I feel towards the matter because some randoms opinion is irrelevant to my life.

I know many people that play league of legends as an escape from real life issues with mental health. I myself have been there, using LoL as a coping mechanism to distract from harmful thoughts. People being general ♥♥♥♥♥ towards other members is kind of ingrained in this community, however people telling each other to kill themselves or hurt themselves in other forms is definitely not ok. For someone of sound mental health they may be able to shake it off and have little to no side effects (tilt). For those with compromised mental health who are already experiencing thoughts or feelings that gravitate towards suicide or harmful behaviour, some ♥♥♥♥ telling them to off themselves might push them over the edge. Particularly due to the numerous times 'go kill yourself irl' actually appears in chat. Have you not heard of people killing themselves due to cyperbullying?
There you have it folks, free ticket to act like a %%%% because you're supposed to have a thick skin.

Or you can look at it the other way, expecting people to not act like a massive jerk doesn't seem over the top to me. Insulting people gains you nothing, and victim blaming is pretty counterproductive.

Another person who believes people who receive abuse need to be immune to it, rather than have it disappear.

*It's the 1800's. Know your place n igger. If you aren't tough enough to take it, you don't deserve to be alive. N iggers get beat up all the time, so grow a thick skin.*

That is a very short sighted and opinionated answer.

People have very different reactions. It is true, that LoL is not the cause of suicides, but Suicides are not cause because people want to die. It is a cry for help.

Putting fuel on the flame should not be an encourage behavior. Now i know this isn't going to stop people from berating each other but people should be mind full of the language they use on people they know nothing about.

Telling people to go kill them self is not an acceptable comment anywhere in this game. IMO

Good for you for not being changed by the insults of others, but the reality is some people are more sensitive than you. No one person is the same and no one will react the same, regardless, we should be making a change and not insulting people, not putting them down, and not making them feel worthless. 

I want you to think about someone you really care about, what if they were getting treated badly in a game and they just wanted to relax and have a good time? What if it really upset them, what if they were having some problems in their life and this was the last straw for them. Would you want this kind of toxic behaviour to end then? 

Just because it doesnt effect you directly doesnt mean it wont ever effect you.
Isn't telling someone to kill themselves considered manslaughter if they actually do it and something else if they don't?

Toxicity is never viable as it directly contributes to losses on top of a poorly performing comrade.  I understand the frustration but being toxic is extremely counter productive to turning the game around into your favour.

And tough titties to the player who mains Lee Jg and someone who has a higher pick order got Jungle before you.  In most leagues (Bronze, Silver etc) saying you main a champion and have a high win rate with it means virtually nothing without proof.

A good rule of order is this:

A soon as you see a negative comment mute that player for the rest of the game.  You will play better for it.

I have had to stop playing League of Legends and go back on medication due to the aggressive and unnecessary behaviour of other players. This was a game I enjoyed, to an extent, it's only downfall is the lack of intervention on the part of Riot, something needs to be done about abusive players its simply getting out of hand.

I have known a few kids in high school, about 5 or so years ago now, who killed themselves due to online bullying, whether it was on facebook or an online game it has real world implications. It gets to a point where having memorials at school for kids who have committed suicide becomes a semi-regular thing, we need to do something to protect them, its no ones fault that younger people are particularily more vulnerable to depression. Its rather upsetting that they often feel they are going it alone, that there is nothing they can do to make it stop and when they cant even enjoy themselves playing a game it becomes a serious concern. 

Im scared for my young cousins, I dont want to see them grow up and start learning about the online world and then see how it slowly eats away at their happiness, I know this is probably a shout into the void, but the more people who are aware the more likely something will be done to fix this. 

I miss playing this game, truly, I'm just too scared to start a game, I get anxious, feel like I am not good enough (because if people tell you enough, even if its not true, you start to believe it). Games should be enjoyable, help us make a better environment for our gamers, young and old. I am more than willing to help and Im sure a hell of a lot of other people want to see a change too. Im glad people are speaking out.

/mute all
